Package com.wallstft.sftp.client

Class ClientSftpFileSystemFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wallstft.sftp.client.ClientSftpFileSystemFactory
  • public class ClientSftpFileSystemFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Establishes a factory for SftpFileSystem session to the specified servers.

    • Method Detail

      • createClientSession

        public org.apache.sshd.client.session.ClientSession createClientSession​(java.lang.String username,
                                                                        java.lang.String host,
                                                                        int port,
                                                                        java.security.KeyPair keyPair)
                                                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a connection to the remote server and uses the KeyPair to 1) validate that the remote server has a matching public-key and 2) that a message encrypted using the public-key can be decrypted using the private-key provided in the KeyPair. NOTE, the SSH server configuration will determine which authentication method, or combination, is used.
        Parameters:
        username - holds the SFTP username
        host - the hostname of the target server
        port - the port on the hostname that SSH is listening
        keyPair - the Public/Private Key pair used to authenticate the user with the remote server.
        Returns:
        returns the ClientSession.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • createClientSession

        public org.apache.sshd.client.session.ClientSession createClientSession​(java.lang.String username,
                                                                        java.lang.String host,
                                                                        int port,
                                                                        java.lang.String password)
                                                                 throws java.io.IOException
        creates a connection and attempts to authenticate using username and password combination. NOTE, the SSH server configuration will determine which authentication method, or combination, is used.
        Parameters:
        username - the username being authenticated on the server
        host - the hostname on which the SSH server is running.
        port - the port on which the SSH server is listening on the hostname specified above.
        password - the password using to authenticate the user on the remote server.
        Returns:
        returns the ClientSession.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • open

        public SftpFileSystemContainer open​(java.lang.String username,
                                    java.lang.String hostname,
                                    int port,
                                    java.security.KeyPair keyPair)
        opens a session and places the session into an SftpFileSystemContainer so that the finalize() method and close() function will ensure the connection is closed once the container goes out of scope. This function will use the KeyPair for authenticating.
        Parameters:
        username - the username being authenticated on the server
        hostname - the hostname on which the SSH server is running.
        port - the port on which the SSH server is listening on the hostname specified above.
        keyPair - the KeyPair, containing private-key and public-key, which is used to authenticate with the remote SSH server.
        Returns:
        returns SftpFileSystemContainer

      • open

        public SftpFileSystemContainer open​(java.lang.String username,
                                    java.lang.String hostname,
                                    int port,
                                    java.lang.String password)
        opens a session and places the session into an SftpFileSystemContainer so that the finalize() method and close() function will ensure the connection is closed once the container goes out of scope. This function will use the password for authenticating.
        Parameters:
        username - the username being authenticated on the server
        hostname - the hostname on which the SSH server is running.
        port - the port on which the SSH server is listening on the hostname specified above.
        password - the password used to authenticate the user with the SSH server.
        Returns:
        returns SftpFileSystemContainer

      • close

        This will close the SSH client connection.
